intro: Centaurea × auricularis, commonly known as the auricle centaury, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flower heads, which are typically surrounded by pale yellow ray florets. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. It is native to southern Europe and has been introduced to other regions as an ornamental. Centaurea × auricularis is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in various environmental conditions.
